Description:
CENTRAL LA: WE NEED YOUR HELP TO DEFEND OUR COMMUNITY FROM ICE! ‚ùåüßä‚ùå
Federal agents are doing their best to terrorize our communities, but we are not afraid! We‚Äôve set up a Community Defense Center at the MacArthur Park Home Depot at 1675 Wilshire Boulevard, and we need volunteers to help us man the booth, conduct patrols, and share resources with the community.

We‚Äôll be here from 7am to 12pm EVERY DAY until we chase these fascist feds out of our city. Hot spots will be provided for those who work from home, and we‚Äôll be purchasing food to share from local vendors. JOIN US!!

Name: ICEwatch: ICE Raids Tactics Map
Description: ICEwatch was last updated in April 2022 and is no longer active as of June 2025. IDP will continue to monitor trends of ICE arrests and raids to create and update our Know Your Rights (KYR) materials. Our hope is to create a similar map documenting ICE actions in our community in the future. All of IDP‚Äôs KYR materials can be found at immdefense.org/kyr.

Name: How to stop an ICE Raid
Description: The ICE raids are meant to make us feel helpless. But now, organizations like @siembranc are empowering communities by providing tools and training to help people take a stand.

Name: Good Information Sharing Practices
Description: Help us gather accurate information by following SALUTE! ü´° Help your neighbors by passing on accurate information.

Name: Health Effects of Police Crowd Control Weapons
Description: What are the projectiles piling up in Los Angeles County streets after weekend deportation protests? They‚Äôre less-lethal munitions ‚Äî weapons designed to control crowds through pain, disorientation, and fear while avoiding fatalities.But ‚Äúless-lethal‚Äù doesn‚Äôt mean harmless. Injuries from ‚Äúless lethal‚Äù munitions can be severe, disfiguring, or occasionally deadly.Here‚Äôs what crowd control weapons do to your body. Read the full story by Sean Beckner-Carmitchel (@acatwithnews) via the link in our bio or at LAPublicPress.org.

Name: Protest Buddy System
Description: Tips for Protestor Safety

Name: Strategies for Sustainable Protest
Description: Protest movements strive to convey a message effectively, exert influence over states and other forces and bring about positive change. These are not easy goals to achieve, but based on the experiences of protest movements, there are a number of tactics that can be followed that make the achievement of these goals and the sustainability of movements more likely.

Name: WHEN DOES PROTEST MAKE A DIFFERENCE?
Description: Day laborer organizer (@daylaborernetwork) and co-founder of @losjornalerosdelnorte Pablo Alvarado (@pablo.alvarado.125) explains why incorporating arts and culture into a protest can be an effective tool for creating ‚Äúpeaceful tension.‚Äù From Z√≥calo‚Äôs August 22, 2024, program, ‚ÄúWhen Does Protest Make a Difference?‚Äù

Name: Call for Resistance against Provocations in Protesting with Dignity and Joy
Description:
Every day, day laborers stand on corners looking for work ‚Äî and face harassment instead.
We ask: stand with us, document, protect.
But don‚Äôt fall into provocations. 
We resist with unity, joy, and courage.
Only the people can save the people.

Name: "Peaceful" & "Non-violent" undermining fascism in protest messaging
Description: Every demand that we condemn ‚Äúviolence‚Äù is a trap to divide us. Every debate about ‚Äúgood vs. bad protesters‚Äù distracts from the real issue: state violence. Our response must always redirect focus to what does matter: who are we fighting for?

Name: You do not need to protest to enact change
Description: Framework on the many roles needed in social movements for change

Name: How to Talk To Kids About What's Going On
Description: How do we talk to our kids when the world feels uncertain? Our children can feel when something isn‚Äôt right. They deserve honesty, safety, and space to feel. This guide is written by a family therapist @luis_thee_lmft who offers five gentle ways to support children during moments of fear, violence, or political unrest. We protect our kids not just with shelter, but with truth, presence, and love. Please share with anyone who needs this right now. üß°

Name: Messaging Guides on how to talk about MAGA's Authoritarian Agenda on Immigration
Description: It is time to make clear who is at fault for the problems we are facing ‚Äì politicians who use racial scapegoating to seize and preserve power and sow division among us.

Name: Creating Community Plans
Description: If someone‚Äôs being taken‚Äîwhat do you do? Who in your life is at risk? Get a few friends together this weekend. Say: ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs figure out how to keep each other safe.‚Äù

Name: ICE Raids Toolkit: Defend Against ICE Raids and Community Arrests
Description: Defend Against ICE Raids and Community Arrests, the product of IDP‚Äôs and CCR‚Äôs collective work against ICE arrests under Bush and Obama, serves as the first comprehensive guide and organizing resource to fight back against the Trump administration‚Äôs efforts to criminalize communities and deport millions of people.

Name: Legal aid for detained day laborers
Description: Do you know a jornalero that was detained in Los Angeles since the raids started? If yes, call (626) 799-3566 Maybe it was a family member, a neighbor, a coworker, or someone from your community. Many people have disappear overnight, without being able to say goodbye, and their loved ones are left without answers. That‚Äôs why it is urgent to identify and locate those who have been detained or deported. From our office, we are working to provide legal support, emotional assistance, and direct help to those who have been deported or are at risk. But to do this, we need your help. If you know someone who was detained or deported, please contact us at: 626-799-3566 Your information could make all the difference. We can help track their whereabouts, connect them with organizations, support their families here, and in some cases even explore options for return or legal protection. No one should face this alone. The persecution of migrants is real‚Äîbut so is our power to organize, to care for one another, and to defend our dignity.

Name: A Farmworker Labor Strike is Coming
Description: California farm workers are organizing, let‚Äôs make sure we are amplifying their fight üó£Ô∏è‚úäüèΩ We can all do something to help. Don‚Äôt forget this is a collective fight for liberation, it starts with fighting for some of our most vulnerable. It starts with you.
